Lane Detection Using CV

This document excerpt describes a lane detection algorithm using OpenCV. It starts by importing necessary libraries and loading an image. The image is then converted to different color spaces (BGR, XYZ, HSV) and grayscale. A Gaussian blur is applied to reduce noise, followed by the Canny edge detection method. The code also includes functions for converting colors and finding regions of interest. The final step involves applying a bitwise operation to select the region of interest.

Key Concepts:

  • Image processing
  • Color conversion
  • Edge detection
  • Region of interest
lane detection computer vision OpenCV
Data Science Intermediate
